A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: While not perfect\, especially answering questions suggested from the previous movie as major plot points with bland answers that leave watchers saying why did the previous movie suggest this was a big deal.  The movie is very good.\n\nLuke Skywalker who in the previous movie was only a hero\, shows so much depth and realism.  Without true peers Luke found himself a man who had always been successful\, but when he makes a tragic mistake he has no peers and closes himself off from everything because he disappointed his closest friends and himself. The movie is a Luke Skywalker triumph... in that a simple hero is brought to life as more than a legend but a real but flawed man dealing with overcoming a mistake.  Mark Hamill should be proud of the performance.
